content.description: Zodiac climbs Serial Killer to its second bolt and moves right. Traverse right on a line of pockets and thin edges to the anchor.
Nice moderate face and slab on left side of the crag
content.location: Second bolted route from the left

content.description:
Two-Bolt Jolt is the left-most route on Black Flower.

Make an awkward boulder move to the 1st bolt. Continue up and trending to the right past 2 bolts to the anchor.

A decent route with hard, bouldery, moves right off the deck. Climbing eases as holds grow towards the anchors. This route has been cleaned a ton since the FA back in 2002 but could still use more traffic.

Son of Dahlia is a link up combining Son of Sam with Black Dahlia.

Climb Son of Sam to the 3rd bolt. Then move right to clip an independent bolt before joining Black Dahlia at its last bolt.
content.location: Begin on the right end of the wall, just left of where the approach trail meets the wall.

content.description: Serial Driller begins at a smooth solution pocket and climbs up and through a band of zenoliths or cobbles. Continue pulling small edges and through a roof at the top.
Climb the featured face up the left white streak.
content.location: Left of center of the Black Flower wall. Climbs the left of the two white streaks.

content.description: Start next to the bench climbing past a good ledge to a small roof, crack to anchors.
Boulder up and slightly left following a vague crack and some cool natural slopers, then join The Ripper at its last bolt and climb to a shared anchor.
content.protection: Four bolts to open hook anchors.
content.location: Just right of The Ripper.  This thing gets 11c in the Louie Anderson / Todd Fertig guidebook but in its current state it felt about 12a.

content.description: Starts up a white face to a high 1st bolt and teared roof. Turn the roof and up past a large white scar in the surrounding brown rock. Bust a couple of difficult moves past a hard to clip bolt and a couple more difficult moves. Continue up slightly easier climbing to the chains.
content.location: Left side of the cliff. Starts 10'-15' left of Hamburger.

content.description: Fun, balancey, climbing up the obvious crack.
content.location: 3rd route from right. Obvious crack, next to bench.

content.description: Start as for Night Stalker, but after the first bolt, continue climbing up and right to follow a shallow seam. Join Son of Sam at that routes last bolt.
content.location: Center of the wall, below the right end of the roof.

content.description: Varied style of sandstone, climbing through a few separate layers of harder rock down low, baseball sized pockets midway and "echo" style texture/blocky features up higher. Due to the seemingly abandoned feel of this area, there is still lots of loose rock from top to bottom of this wall. It would be a great route if really cleaned and updated, the pockets are really fun!  ( choosing which one will crumble and which will stay intact)
content.location: Sharing first bolt with " Do it for Davey", Hamburger goes left after this bolt and up through the pockets ending at the top of this wall.

content.description: Thin and crimpy climbing on suspect (glued) holds.
Carefully climb the fractured and blocky tower past 3 bolts. A mid-height crux requires navigating around some suspect blocks nested in the crack.
content.location:
Left side of the face, left of the bench.

Twenty feet right of Black Face.

content.description: Jam the crack to a broken blocky section. Carefully climb through and around loose, fractured blocks and flakes to the anchor shared with Two-Bolt Jolt. The quantity of large blocks scattered around the base are testament to the looseness and lack of attention given to this route.
content.protection: Standard rack with wide gear to 4 inches.
content.location: Far left of the Black Flower. Ten feet right of Two-Bolt Jolt. Look for the wide blocky crack.

content.description: Same start as for Hamburger, but after the 1st bolt climb up and right to follow the line of bolts as it diagonals up and right.
content.location: Left of center of the face, below the diminishing roof at mid-height.

content.description: Black Sam is a link up. Begin climbing Black Dahlia to its third bolt. After clipping the 3rd bolt, move left and climb past an independent bolt to join Son of Sam at that routes last bolt.
Black Dahlia follows a series of shallow seams up a vertical black water streak on the right end of the wall. Black Dahlia tends to seep and takes days to dry out after a rain.
